_metadata.title: Information Barriers - Organizational Segments
_metadata.description: Creates organizational segments for Microsoft Purview Information Barriers based on department attributes. Segments define logical user groups (Research, Trading, Compliance, Board) that can then be used in Information Barrier policies to restrict or allow communication and collaboration between groups.

prerequisites: Connect to Security & Compliance PowerShell: Connect-IPPSSession
Information Barriers must be enabled for the tenant
Azure AD user accounts must have the Department attribute populated for segment filtering
Scoped directory search must be enabled in Exchange Online: Set-OrganizationConfig -InformationBarrierMode Enabled
Plan segment definitions with Legal and Compliance teams before deployment
deploymentSteps: 1. Verify Azure AD Department attributes are populated for all in-scope users
2. Enable Information Barriers mode: Set-OrganizationConfig -InformationBarrierMode Enabled
4. Create each organizational segment using New-OrganizationSegment
6. Proceed to PV21 to create Information Barrier policies between segments
_notes.rollbackProcedure: Remove-OrganizationSegment -Identity '<SegmentName>' for each segment. Note: segments that are referenced by active Information Barrier policies cannot be removed until the policies are removed first.

enableInformationBarriers._note: One-time configuration to enable Information Barriers for the tenant

parameters.Name: Research
parameters.Description: Organizational segment for the Research department. Used in Information Barrier policies to control communication with other sensitive departments.

parameters.Name: Trading
parameters.Description: Organizational segment for the Trading department. Used in Information Barrier policies to prevent communication with Research and Board segments.

parameters.Name: Compliance
parameters.Description: Organizational segment for the Compliance department. Compliance may communicate with all segments for oversight and regulatory purposes.

parameters.Name: Board
parameters.Description: Organizational segment for the Board of Directors. Used in Information Barrier policies to restrict communication with Trading segment to prevent insider trading.

segments.name: Compliance
segments.description: Compliance officers and regulatory affairs team

segments.name: Board
segments.description: Board of Directors and executive leadership

policySettings._note: Segments are created as active definitions. They have no enforcement effect until Information Barrier policies (PV21) are created and applied.
